title: Exploring the Deep
content: Hereâ€™s an image from the Rubin Observatory LSST Camera. Nearly all of the objects in this image are galaxies, but some appear so small they could easily be mistaken for stars. This image shows thousands of galaxies of different sizes, brightness, and colors.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Click on a galaxy to add a data point to the plot. Be sure you select enough galaxies so that your data shows a trend between brightness and distance. To accomplish this you will need to select a range of galaxies that contain both bright and very small, faint galaxies. Select at least 40 galaxies that span the x- axis. At least one of the galaxies should be at a distance beyond 19 billion light years.
